titles.title: Child Labor Safety Act
To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the penalty for certain child labor violations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

bill.summary:
9/10/2008--Introduced.
Child Labor Safety Act - Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1998 to subject, upon conviction, an employer who willfully violates child labor requirements and prohibitions to a fine of up to $50,000, or imprisonment for up to six months, for each employee who was the subject of such violation, or both. Increases the maximum employer civil penalty: (1) from $11,000 to $50,000 for each employee who was the subject of a child labor violation; and (2) from $50,000 to $100,000 for each such violation that causes the death or serious injury of any employee under age 18.
